<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/sec-threatens-sue-coinbase?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The SEC’s “Really Sketchy Behavior”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/sec-threatens-sue-coinbase?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A gavel about to hit the Coinbase logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzMwL2NvaW5iYXNlX2NvdXJ0X2Nhc2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s how Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong described the SEC’s latest <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/08/coinbase-shares-fall-after-it-reveals-sec-plans-to-sue-over-interest-earning-product.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crypto crackdown</a>. According to Coinbase, the Wall Street regulator has sent the crypto exchange a “Wells notice” regarding its upcoming lending product, Lend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wells notice = a threat to take legal action. In this case, the SEC says they’ll sue Coinbase if and when it launches Lend.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lend would let Coinbase users earn interest by lending digital assets (specifically, a stablecoin called USD Coin) to others.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a blog post and a nowadays-mandatory Twitter thread, Coinbase executives said they <a href="https://blog.coinbase.com/the-sec-has-told-us-it-wants-to-sue-us-over-lend-we-have-no-idea-why-a3a1b6507009?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don’t understand</a> what grounds the SEC is suing them on, and that the SEC <a href="https://twitter.com/brian_armstrong/status/1435439621190471683?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has refused</a> to loop them in.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s what they </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>do</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> know: </strong>The SEC considers Lend’s offerings a “security,” meaning a contract of investment such as a company’s stock or government bonds. The agency has built its case against Coinbase based on that categorization, citing two Supreme court decisions that outline rules around securities.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coinbase contends that Lend doesn’t involve securities and called that assumption “strange.”  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why crack down on cryptocurrency now?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just last month, SEC Chair Gary Gensler called crypto the “Wild West,” saying it’s “rife with fraud, scams, and abuse in certain applications.” Gensler thinks the government needs to add <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/sec-chief-gary-gensler-calls-crypto-wild-west-speech?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some guardrails</a> to protect individual investors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Going after Coinbase, the US’ biggest cryptocurrency exchange, would set an example for every other company in the space...especially those rolling out their own digital asset-lending products.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Crypto proponents hoped that Gensler, who became SEC chair in April, would bring clearer regulation to the industry, but they have so far been disappointed by what they consider the SEC’s confusing and overly harsh actions. <em>– JW</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/energy-department-report-says-solar-power-almost-half-us-electricity-2050?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lorde’s Not the Only One Thinking About Solar Power
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US Energy Department <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-climate-environment-and-nature-united-states-climate-change-c5cc5de8c77a7f3d0888a6b25abf1866?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that solar energy could power 44% of the country’s electricity by 2050, up from 3% currently, in a major report released yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>US solar installations grew a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/16/the-us-solar-industry-posted-record-growth-in-2020-despite-covid-19-new-report-finds.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record</a> 43% from 2019 to 2020, which means that 20% of the country’s entire solar capacity was installed last year alone. But it’s still no match for coal and natural gas, which currently provide 60% of the country’s electricity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To achieve a net-zero carbon grid by 2035, the US would need to quadruple its solar use—and that will require enormous investments.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The government, businesses, and consumers would have to spend about $562 billion over the next 30 years to replace old energy infrastructure with a fresh coat of solar paint.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another barrier: the US solar industry's dependence on China. The Biden administration still has tariffs on Chinese construction materials, making solar deployment more expensive.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Energy Department is acting as the coach drawing up a play during halftime. It will ultimately be up to Congress to put this plan into action. <em>– MM</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/examining-pop-culture-legacy-september-11-attacks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Pop Culture Legacy of 9/11
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/examining-pop-culture-legacy-september-11-attacks?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Avengers " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTc2L2F2ZW5nZXJzLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Marvel's Avengers</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Leading up to the anniversary of the September 11 attacks this Saturday, we’ll feature stories that explore the economic impact of 9/11, 20 years later.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today we’ll try to cram into 200 words a topic that people have written entire books about: How 9/11 influenced Hollywood.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before September 11, 2001, movies like <em>Independence Day </em>and <em>Armageddon</em> <a href="https://www.vox.com/2016/9/9/12814898/pop-culture-response-to-9-11?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gleefully depicted</a> the annihilation of American cities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the aftermath of 9/11…that stuff was #toosoon, and Hollywood scrubbed visuals that would remind viewers of the attacks. <em>Lilo and Stitch </em>(released in 2002) swapped out a sequence of Stitch in an airplane weaving through buildings with the little guy in a spacecraft flying among mountains.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>During the 2000s, the fantasy (</span><span><em>Lord of the Rings</em></span><span>, </span><span><em>Harry Potter</em></span><span>) and superhero (</span><span><em>The Dark Knight</em></span><span>, </span><span><em>The Avengers) </em></span><span>genres took over the box office, providing viewers with escapism and the comfort that </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-9-11-changed-pop-culture-in-america-11631026800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">people in capes</a></span><span> would save us from incomprehensible evil.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some, but not much, TV and film directly referenced the attacks, from <em>United 93 </em>(2006)<em> </em>to <em>Zero Dark Thirty </em>(2012). And a few post-9/11 shows, most notably <em>24</em>, have been criticized for <a href="https://repositories.lib.utexas.edu/handle/2152/31585?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">glorifying and legitimizing torture</a> in the pursuit of counterterrorism. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, with monsters once again razing cities in films like <em>Godzilla vs. Kong</em>, it appears that 9/11 imagery has become “subtext instead of text,” Vox wrote.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Conversation starter: </strong>Given that we’re living through another traumatic event right now (Covid-19), are you observing similar patterns in current pop culture? How long will it be before a director pitches a pandemic film? — <em>NF</em></p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/key-performance-indicators-september-9?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/key-performance-indicators-september-9?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Screenshot from Oatly's Super Bowl commercial" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzMyL29hdGx5X3Nfc3VwZXJfYm93bF9jb21tZXJjaWFsLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Oatly</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>NBC is <a href="https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/super-bowl-commercials-nbc-sports-1235059027/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">selling Super Bowl ads</a> for up to $6.5 million, a record high and a significant bump from the $5.6 million average a year ago. If you want to snag a spot, call up your local television exec now—there are fewer than five 30-second slots left and word has it that the Oatly CEO just learned how to play the accordion. (Side note: The NFL season starts tonight.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“When you view the world through a dirty lens, everything looks dirty. When you consider all of the facts through a clean lens you will see a different picture. The reality of what happened at Theranos is far, far more complicated than what you’ve heard so far.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lance Wade, a lawyer for Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes, made his <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-08/holmes-prosecutors-target-lying-and-cheating-in-theranos-trial?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pitch</a> during opening arguments for the blockbuster fraud trial captivating Silicon Valley.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>In the Afghan countryside, the endless killing of civilians turned women against the occupiers who claimed to be helping them. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/09/13/the-other-afghan-women?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/lululemon-reports-better-expected-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Jeans Comeback Is Overblown
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/lululemon-reports-better-expected-earnings?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Entrance to Lululemon store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MzMzL2x1bHVsZW1vbl9zdG9yZS5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lululemon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lululemon, the brand known for expensive athleisure apparel we tell ourselves is an “investment,” said that business is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/08/lululemon-lulu-q2-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">so good</a> it’s expecting to surpass its 2023 revenue target by the end of this year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shares popped more than 13% in extended trading after the company topped Q2 estimates and announced a major hike to its full-year outlook.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The earnings beat shows that the pandemic-era boom in athleisure hasn’t slowed down as we enter month No. 18 of this thing. In fact, the only thing that’s slowing down for Lululemon is its <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/lululemon-raises-full-year-forecast-betting-strong-athleisure-demand-2021-09-08/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supply chain</a>, which has experienced hiccups in Vietnam due to Covid-related factory closures. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>what do you do when you hit your revenue goals two years ahead of schedule? <a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/whats-next-for-lululemons-tech-ambitions/601500/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Double down</a> on becoming a "tech" company. Lululemon has already integrated Mirror, the at-home fitness company it bought last year, into 150 of its brick-and-mortar stores. And recent patents show Lulu could be exploring wellness products that use biometric monitoring technology.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Warm up for Saturday's full-sized crossword with a confidence booster from the Mini. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/08/brew-mini-wheres-lie?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Solve it here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than your landlord’s promise to fix your ceiling. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrypto crackdown\u003c/a\u003e. According to Coinbase, the Wall Street regulator has sent the crypto exchange a “Wells notice” regarding its upcoming lending product, Lend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWells notice = a threat to take legal action. In this case, the SEC says they’ll sue Coinbase if and when it launches Lend.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLend would let Coinbase users earn interest by lending digital assets (specifically, a stablecoin called USD Coin) to others.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a blog post and a nowadays-mandatory Twitter thread, Coinbase executives said they \u003ca href=\"https://blog.coinbase.com/the-sec-has-told-us-it-wants-to-sue-us-over-lend-we-have-no-idea-why-a3a1b6507009?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon’t understand\u003c/a\u003e what grounds the SEC is suing them on, and that the SEC \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/brian_armstrong/status/1435439621190471683?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas refused\u003c/a\u003e to loop them in.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s what they \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003edo\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e know: \u003c/strong\u003eThe SEC considers Lend’s offerings a “security,” meaning a contract of investment such as a company’s stock or government bonds. The agency has built its case against Coinbase based on that categorization, citing two Supreme court decisions that outline rules around securities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCoinbase contends that Lend doesn’t involve securities and called that assumption “strange.”  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy crack down on cryptocurrency now?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust last month, SEC Chair Gary Gensler called crypto the “Wild West,” saying it’s “rife with fraud, scams, and abuse in certain applications.” Gensler thinks the government needs to add \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/03/sec-chief-gary-gensler-calls-crypto-wild-west-speech?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome guardrails\u003c/a\u003e to protect individual investors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoing after Coinbase, the US’ biggest cryptocurrency exchange, would set an example for every other company in the space...especially those rolling out their own digital asset-lending products.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eCrypto proponents hoped that Gensler, who became SEC chair in April, would bring clearer regulation to the industry, but they have so far been disappointed by what they consider the SEC’s confusing and overly harsh actions. \u003cem\u003e– JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLorde’s Not the Only One Thinking About Solar Power\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US Energy Department \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-climate-environment-and-nature-united-states-climate-change-c5cc5de8c77a7f3d0888a6b25abf1866?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that solar energy could power 44% of the country’s electricity by 2050, up from 3% currently, in a major report released yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eUS solar installations grew a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/16/the-us-solar-industry-posted-record-growth-in-2020-despite-covid-19-new-report-finds.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord\u003c/a\u003e 43% from 2019 to 2020, which means that 20% of the country’s entire solar capacity was installed last year alone. But it’s still no match for coal and natural gas, which currently provide 60% of the country’s electricity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo achieve a net-zero carbon grid by 2035, the US would need to quadruple its solar use—and that will require enormous investments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe government, businesses, and consumers would have to spend about $562 billion over the next 30 years to replace old energy infrastructure with a fresh coat of solar paint.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnother barrier: the US solar industry's dependence on China. The Biden administration still has tariffs on Chinese construction materials, making solar deployment more expensive.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Energy Department is acting as the coach drawing up a play during halftime. It will ultimately be up to Congress to put this plan into action. \u003cem\u003e– MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eLeading up to the anniversary of the September 11 attacks this Saturday, we’ll feature stories that explore the economic impact of 9/11, 20 years later.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday we’ll try to cram into 200 words a topic that people have written entire books about: How 9/11 influenced Hollywood.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore September 11, 2001, movies like \u003cem\u003eIndependence Day \u003c/em\u003eand \u003cem\u003eArmageddon\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2016/9/9/12814898/pop-culture-response-to-9-11?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egleefully depicted\u003c/a\u003e the annihilation of American cities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the aftermath of 9/11…that stuff was #toosoon, and Hollywood scrubbed visuals that would remind viewers of the attacks. \u003cem\u003eLilo and Stitch \u003c/em\u003e(released in 2002) swapped out a sequence of Stitch in an airplane weaving through buildings with the little guy in a spacecraft flying among mountains.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDuring the 2000s, the fantasy (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eLord of the Rings\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHarry Potter\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e) and superhero (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Dark Knight\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Avengers) \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003egenres took over the box office, providing viewers with escapism and the comfort that \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-9-11-changed-pop-culture-in-america-11631026800?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epeople in capes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e would save us from incomprehensible evil.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome, but not much, TV and film directly referenced the attacks, from \u003cem\u003eUnited 93 \u003c/em\u003e(2006)\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eto \u003cem\u003eZero Dark Thirty \u003c/em\u003e(2012). And a few post-9/11 shows, most notably \u003cem\u003e24\u003c/em\u003e, have been criticized for \u003ca href=\"https://repositories.lib.utexas.edu/handle/2152/31585?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eglorifying and legitimizing torture\u003c/a\u003e in the pursuit of counterterrorism. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, with monsters once again razing cities in films like \u003cem\u003eGodzilla vs. Kong\u003c/em\u003e, it appears that 9/11 imagery has become “subtext instead of text,” Vox wrote.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConversation starter: \u003c/strong\u003eGiven that we’re living through another traumatic event right now (Covid-19), are you observing similar patterns in current pop culture?
